titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the IBT COVID-19 Response Collection, 2020 IBT0093
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-10 15:43:29 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: IBT COVID-19 Response Collection
did.physloc: Records are stored on a web-accessible server.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into 2 series: International Brotherhood of Teamsters websites and Teamsters Locals and Affiliates websites.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was harvested and archived through Archive-It and Social Feed Manager

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: On March 13, 2020, President Donald Trump declared a national emergency in response to the growing number of COVID-19 cases nationwide. Members of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the many Teamsters' affiliates and locals are employed in so-called "essential" services; nurses, grocery store clerks, police officers, delivery drivers, airline workers, and warehouse employees. This meant that, at a time when most of the country was at home, Teamsters' members were going to work to perform jobs that the rest of country depended on to run. This file was started in an effort to document and identify for future researchers how the IBT and the various Teamsters affiliates and locals have been communicating with and assisting their members in safely performing these duties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is compiled by a librarian from various IBT and Teamsters' local web-based sources. The list provides a guide for researchers to find all identified tweets and webpages addressing COVID-19 and the Teamsters' unions responses to either the pandemic or the quarantine.

controlaccess.subject: COVID-19 (Disease)

did.unitdate: Posted to Twitter between March 16 and October 15, 2020

did.unittitle: Teamsters' COVID-19 Tweetset

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This material is available through Tweetset, GW Libraries' search interface for navigating archived tweets. The hashtags associated with the Teamsters' experience and response to the COVID-19 pandemic and quarantine have already been identified. They are listed here with the count of tweets containing each hashtag.

Bendthecurve 143 tweets, CARESAct 40 tweets, CouncilsNotCOVID 25 tweets, coronavirus 950 tweets, CoronavirusPandemic 423 tweets, COVID 723 tweets, Covid19 302 tweets, Covid_19 101 tweets, COVID-19 77 tweets, COVID19 176 tweets, COVID19US 4 tweets, COVIDfrontlines 1 tweet, essential 56 tweets, EssentialAndExcluded 177 tweets, essentialworkers, EssentialWorker, FlattenTheCurve, frontline, FrontlineHeroes, HEROES, HEROESAct, HeroesNeedMasks, HiddenHeroes, MaskUpNV, MaskUpMN, NewYorkHERO, paidsickleave, PaidSickLeave, pandemic, PPE, ProtectHealthcareWorkers, ProtectNYHeroes, ProtectWorkers, StayHealthy, StaySafe

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: If accessing this information from an off-campus network, a full list of tweets is not available to you. The database will provide a list of tweet IDs. A rehydrator will allow you to use the tweet IDs to retrieve all active tweets.

did.unittitle: Teamsters Web Archives
did.unitdate: Harvested from the web between April 9, 2020 and October 30, 2020

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is derived from multiple websites associated with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters as well as Teamsters locals that were harvested and preserved through the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine. Some links described in the item records may not be found in GW's instance of the captured website.

did.unittitle: May Day Strike at Amazon, Walmart, Fed Ex, Target, Instacart, and Whole Foods

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dangerous pandemic-caused working conditions at warehouses, in the "gig economy," and at big box stores are forcing tens of thousands of workers at six large firms – Amazon, Walmart, FedEx, Target, Instacart, Shipt, and Whole Foods – into a walkout during their lunch breaks on May 1.

did.unittitle: Important Unemployment Extension Requirements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New State Extension Comes with Stricter Job Search Requirements On May 24, due to the high unemployment rate, Washington entered an 'Extended Benefits' (EB) period. Entended benefits adds up to 13 more weeks of beneftis to qualifying claims.

did.unittitle: 5 recruits, 6 instructors at El Paso Police Academy test positive for coronavirus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The El Paso Municipal Police Officer's Assosication reported to ABC-7 that five of their recruits in the police academy, as well as six training officers there have tested positive for Covid-19. EPPD became aware the outbreak at the academy in early July.

did.unittitle: Colorado Health and Safety workplace protections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bill makes it unlawful for employers in Colorado to retaliate against workers for raising health and safety issues during a pandemic. Also, it allows employees to wear their own PPE.

did.unittitle: State & Local Face Mask Requirements for Public Places

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reminder for travelers to check the state and local requirements for face masks when passing through, since the rules vary. Local 7777.

did.unittitle: Teamsters call on Bill Gates to Provide PPE to sanitation workers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bulletin explaining the teamster request for Bill Gates to provide PPE to sanitation workers. The Teamsters are launching a digital advertising campaign around its annual shareholder meeting on Friday. The union is asking for members to sign a letter, "Tell Bill Gates: Use your power to keep sanitation workers safe." It represents more than 7,000 Republic Services workers, which is about 20 percent of the company's workforce.

did.unittitle: Reporting Deaths or Illness In Flight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 42 CFR 71.21 requires the pilots of international flights to the United States to report before arrival any deaths or illnesses (as defined in the regulations) among passengers or crew to CDC's quarantine station at or nearest to the airport of arrival. This may be done by a report to ATC or the company using established means for that purpose.

did.unittitle: Teamsters call for enforceable worker protections, testing following EO requiring meatpacking plants to remain open

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Apr. 30, 2020 | In response to the executive order issued this week mandating meatpacking plants remain open during the COVID-19 crisis, the Teamsters Union called on the administration and federal, state, and local regulators today to enforce worker protections and increase testing on the job for food supply chain workers.
